description:
T9 - Ash Tree - Clear property by 2m.
T10 - Ash Tree - Clear lamp coumn by 1m. 2.Clear property by 2m. 3.Clear crown over road by 6m crown thin 20%.
T17 - Cherry Tree - Remove epicormic growth to height 4m.
T23 - Ash Tree - Cut back to previous points whilst leaving fresh growth.
T27 - Cherry Tree - 1.Cut back property side by 2m. 2.Crown lift to 2m. 3.Crown thin 15%.
T29 - Cherry Tree - Cut back property side by up to 2m. Crown thin 20%.
T30 - Purple Norway - Crown thin 20%. Crown lift 4m.
T31 - Rowan - Crown thin 20%.
T32 - Silver Birch Tree - 1.Clear out dead wood, crossing and upright branches. 2.Crown lift 3-4m.
T35 - Cherry - Fell and replace.
T38 - Purple Norway - Remove deadwood.
T46 - Cherry Tree - Remove basal growth at base of tree.
T54 - Sycamore Tree - Remove epicormic growth to crown height (5m above ground level).
T55 - Cherry Tree - Remove epicormic growth to crown height (5m above ground level).
T57 - Bird Cherry - Remove epicormic growth to crown height (5m above ground level).
T61 - Cherry Plum - Fell replace.
T64 - Maple - Remove deadwood.
T74 - Alder - Clear property by 2m. Crown lift to 4m.
T85 - Hawthorn - Fell and replace.
T90 - Whitebeam - Crown thin 25%.
decision_conditions:
1. Tree Planting Condition:  Three replacement trees are to be planted within twelve months of the removal of the existing [species] trees.  The position, size and species of the replacement tree are to be agreed in writing by the local planning authority prior to planting taking place. Larger canopy species of  trees are expected in large open spaces Details of soil preparation, staking, irrigation and maintenance of the tree are also to be agreed in writing by the local planning authority prior to planting taking place.

Reason: To ensure the continued amenity provided by the tree and the planting of an appropriate species.


2.	Condition:  If the replacement trees die, fail to establish, are removed, destroyed, uprooted or become seriously damaged or diseased within 5 years of the date of this consent, they must be replaced with other trees of the same size and species, and in the same location within one year of dying. 

Reason: To ensure the continued amenity provided by the tree and the planting of an appropriate species.
